N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 454.3 - General requirements for operation of a safe home network

State Regulations
(a) Safe home
networks are responsible for approving safe homes Residents may only be placed
in those safe homes which have met the requirements for approval as contained
in section
454.9
of this Part. (b) Safe home networks having a maximum
length of stay policy of less than 90 days must have an established linkage, to
the extent shelters and services are available, with an approved domestic
violence shelter or domestic violence program to refer safe home residents who
continue to be in need of temporary shelter and emergency services beyond the
stay permitted at a safe home. (c) Safe home networks must develop a recruitment and retention plan to facilitate
the availability of safe homes for victims of domestic violence and their
children who need temporary shelter and emergency services. Such plan should
articulate the strategies the safe home network is using to generate a
sufficient number of safe homes as indicated on the safe home network operating
certificate. Notes
